alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 9:31AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...portions of Sonoma County. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 AM PST, emergency management reported roadway flooding, particularly along Mark West Creek. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Sebastopol, Cotati, Roseland, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Larkfield-Wikiup, Forestville, South Santa Rosa and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
